greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of distinct values of X*(3*X-1) mod n.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Multiplicative with a(2^e) = 2^(e-1), a(3^e) = 3^e, a(p^e) = 1 + floor( p^(e+1)/(2*p+2) ) for prime p >= 5.
mathematica: f[2, e_] := 2^(e-1); f[3, e_] := 3^e; f[p_, e_] := 1 + Floor[p^(e+1)/(2*p+2)]; a[1] = 1; a[n_] := Times @@ f @@@ FactorInteger[n]; Array[a, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Sep 13 2020 *)
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 01 2018
